column4: hey guys, my pages are taking really long to resolve, this is what my network/interfaces file looks like http://pastebin.com/m6da7106a , what could be wrong?
anyone know?
no
dsl here at work
not sure what it is
I'm using chrome
ok let me check the file 1 sec
should I edit that file if it's wrong? cellofellow?
no
how is your NIC configured?
do you use network manager or ifupdown?
that's network manager. So, it's a dynamic IP address?
cheap router might be overloaded.
what does `time host google.com` show? how slow is it really?
how's its speed compare to just pinging your router?
is your DNS server the same box as your gateway?
can you pastebin your /etc/resolv.conf?
yea I suppose
sync3times the nameserver is wrong I think
that's odd
this resolv.conf file is generated by network-manager according to data it receives from the DHCP server (most likely the router).
the router seems to be misconfigured to give 192.168.0.1 instead of 192.168.1.1.
so what happens is your system waits for 192.168.0.1 to time out before going to the backup internet server.
